an4.147:4.1: “Mendicants, when these four times are rightly developed and progressed, they gradually lead to the ending of defilements.
an4.147:4.3: A time for listening to the teaching, a time for discussing the teaching, a time for serenity, and a time for discernment.
an4.147:5.1: It’s like when it rains heavily on a mountain top, and the water flows downhill to fill the hollows, crevices, and creeks.
an4.147:5.2: As they become full, they fill up the pools.
an4.147:5.3: The pools fill up the lakes,
an4.147:5.4: the lakes fill up the streams,
an4.147:5.5: and the streams fill up the rivers.
an4.147:5.6: And as the rivers become full, they fill up the ocean.
an4.147:5.7: In the same way, when these four times are rightly developed and progressed, they gradually lead to the ending of defilements.”
